Participants.evidence: patients with obstructive, unresectable distal gastric tumours

Objective.evidence: The objective was to compare gastric partitioning to gastrojejunostomy

Method_Outcome.evidence: gastric outlet obstruction scoring system scale as the main outcome

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using computer-generated software available online

Number_Randomised.evidence: Over 7 years, 90 patients were initially randomized

Number_Analysed.evidence: 25 patients were included in the gastrojejunostomy group and 27 in the partitioning group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Acceptance of normal diet was more frequently reached by patients in the partitioning group (96% versus 72%; P = 0.022)

Harms.evidence: Patients in the partitioning group received more frequent red blood cell transfusions (81% versus 52%; P = 0.024)
